258: Did you know that if static electricity builds in Mareep’s body, its fleece doubles in volume? This fleece grows continually, but there is a lot of air within that coat, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter. During the summer, the fleece will fully shed, but it grows back in a week!
259: Did you know that Grimer thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories? Smelling too putrid to touch, even weeds won’t grow in this Pokémon's path. Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again!
260: Did you know that the richer the whipped cream that Alcremie produces, the happier it is? Desserts made using this cream are invariably delicious, so many pastry chefs strive to have an Alcremie as their partner. When it trusts a Trainer, this Pokémon will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream!
261: Did you know that by swallowing large amounts of water, Vanilluxe can make snow clouds inside their bodies? If both heads get angry simultaneously, they will then use these snow clouds to attack foes with violent blizzards, burying everything in snow. Vanilluxe can create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love from skiers and snowboarders!
262: Did you know that Happiny carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of Chansey? Happiny loves round white things, and believes that the round, white rock that it carries is an egg. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock!
263: Did you know that the shock of its bouncing makes Spoink’s heart pump? As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing, because if it stops, its heart will stop. As a result, Spoink doesn’t ever stop bouncing, even while its asleep!
264: Did you know that as Silicobra digs, it swallows the sand and stores it in its neck pouch? This Pokémon can carry more than 17 pounds of sand at once, and can move quite easily even with all that weight. It uses this sand blind its enemies, giving it an opportunity to burrow in the ground to hide!
265: Did you know that Yamask retains the memories of its former life? The mask this Pokémon is seen carrying around is its face from its time as a human, and there are times where it will look at it and cry. It will ramble through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face!
266: Did you know that there is a legend that says Kommo-o is covered in glittering scales in order to drive away a great darkness covering the world? It goes on to theorize that the reason these Pokémon seek out battles are to gain the power needed to defeat this darkness. When Kommo-o howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebration can be heard from all around!
267: Did you know that Slurpuff’s sense of smell is a hundred million times more sensitive than that of a humans? With its highly attuned senses, it can distinguish even the faintest of odors, so all the various smells tells it about everything in the area. It can even sniff out a person’s mental and physical condition by taking in their scent!
268: Did you know that to fire its poison spikes, Qwilfish must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water at once? When facing a larger opponent, it will swallow as much water as it can to match the opponent’s size. The small spikes covering its body developed from scales, and they inject a toxin that causes fainting, so be careful when handling this Pokémon!
269: Did you know that once it strikes, Golbat will not stop draining energy from the victim, even if it gets too heavy to fly? This Pokémon attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning, and will use its sharp fangs to bite and suck blood from its target. However hard its victims’ hide may be, it punctures with its fangs and gorges itself with blood!
270: Did you know that a single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper just by flaring its frill? This   Pokémon stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds. One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city!
271: Did you know that the shell on Turtonator’s back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck? Due to its diet of sulfur and other minerals, both its shell and droppings are highly explosive. When hunting, this Pokémon will strike its shell with its tail to trigger an explosion!
272: Did you know that Castform’s feelings change with the weather? Well known for its weather-based appearance, this Pokémon gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water!
273: Did you know that the armor Escavalier wears is the stolen shell of a Shelmet? This steel armor protects their whole body, and they defend themselves and attack with its two lances. Even when in trouble, they face their opponents bravely!
274: Did you know that Misdreavus loves to watch people it’s scared? This Pokémon likes to play mischievous tricks such as wailing to startle people at night and yank people’s hair from behind without warning. Apparently, the red spheres around its neck absorb these feelings of fear to turn them into nutrition for itself!
275: Did you know that Drednaw’s fangs are strong and sharp enough to bite through rock and iron? With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey. Drednaw can also rapidly extend its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and taken them down!
276: Did you know that Skuntank can spray a vile-smelling liquid from the tip of its tail? Even though this fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester, the potency of the smell dims after a few squirts. Skuntank can spray this liquid over 160 feet, so be careful when approaching this Pokémon!
277: Did you know that the light on Litwick’s head shines brighter and eerier the younger the life this Pokémon absorbs? While shining this light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it. This Pokémon in particular is known for taking lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world!
278: Did you know that Trapinch’s giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders? A very patient Pokémon, Trapinch will dig an inescapable pit in a desert and wait for its prey to come tumbling down. Once something falls into its trap, there’s no escape!
279: Did you know that in a south sea nation, there are people that live in communities built on groups of Corsola? Clusters of Corsola congregate to warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller Pokémon. Their branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight, and the tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty!
280: Did you know that Pyroar’s fiery breath can reach temperatures of over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit? Mostly for show, Pyroar will usually use this breath to viciously threaten any challengers. The male Pyroar in particular are known for being lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, they will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety!
281: Did you know that in times of desperation, Crabominable can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets? This Pokémon stores coldness in its pincers to pummel its foes, having enough power to smash thick walls of ice to bits. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches!
282: Did you know that as a slow walker, Graveler prefer to roll down slopes to move? Often seen rolling down mountain trails, this Pokémon pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path. After all, with its free and uncaring nature, obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid!
283: Did you know that with the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, Grimmsnarl can overwhelm even a Pokémon like Machamp? Its hairs work like muscle fibers, and when its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would. Grimmsnarl is capable of moving this hair around to its whims, so make sure to keep an eye on it while battling!
284: Did you know that somewhere in the world is a cemetery just for Marowak? The bone it chooses is its key weapon, and Marowak is capable of throwing said bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO its targets. This Pokémon has also been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others!
285: Did you know that Bonsly’s crying is actually not crying at all? Bonsly live in arid environments, and it leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels. Bonsly does not deal with water well, and if its body gets too damp, it will die!
286: Did you know that Sawsbuck will migrate according to the seasons? One glance at a Sawsbuck’s horns can tell you what the season was, as the horns change according to the season. Due to these migration patterns, Sawsbuck have also been called the harbingers of spring!
287: Did you know that for some reason, only female Salazzles have been found? These females create a reverse harem of male Salandit by emitting a gas laden with pheromones to captivate them. Salazzle live deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it!
288: Did you know that Illumise can attract Volbeat by using a sweet fragrance? Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric patterns in the night sky, earning respect from its peers the more complex the design is. Scientists that study these patterns say there are over 200 confirmed patterns so far!
289: Did you know that because Aipom uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy? This hand-like tail can be cleverly manipulated to Aipom’s needs, and its powerful enough that it can grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air with ease. Since this Pokémon lives atop tall trees, Aipom also uses this tail for balance!
290: Did you know that if something happens that Tyrunt doesn’t like, it will throw a tantrum and run wild? A spoiled and selfish Pokémon, Tyrunt likes to be pampered and revered by its trainer. With its violent disposition, it can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around, so be careful when handling or training them!
291: Did you know that through the bond it forms with its Trainer, Silvally will grow stronger and destroy the control mask it wears as a Type: Null? Although called Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known. Only a solid bond of trust between Silvally and its Trainer can awaken its hidden power!
292: Did you know that once attacked, Wobbuffet will inflate its body to pump up its counterstrike? Never the first to attack, this Pokémon certainly lives up to its moniker as the Patient Pokémon. If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other’s endurance!
293: Did you know that Paras will burrow under the ground to gnaw on tree roots? As it sucks on the roots, the mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition and grow larger. These mushrooms, also known as tochukaso mushrooms, are highly valued as medicine for extending life!
294: Did you know that Carracosta will eat every last bite of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones? This Pokémon is capable of eating Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells. Its incredible jaw strength allows them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey, enhancing the strength of its own shell!
295: Did you know that Milcery are born from sweet-smelling particles in the air? Its body is made completely of cream, adding to its sweet-smelling nature. It’s said that any patisserie visited by a Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune!
296: Did you know that Heatran’s body circulates magma rather than blood through its body? With its body being made of rugged steel, it is partially melted in spots due to the heat permeating from within its body. It dwells in volcanic caves, where it digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl along the ceilings and walls!
297: Did you know that Flygon is also known as “The Desert Spirit”? Flygon is capable of whipping up a sandstorm by flapping its wings, and the flapping sounds like a series of notes that could be misconstrued as a woman's singing. It seldom appears where people can see it, so if you manage to spot one, count yourself lucky!
298: Did you know that Espeon uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions? The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move. By reading the air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move!
299: Did you know that Electrode amuses itself by exploding? This Pokémon can store electric energy under very high pressures, where even the slightest shock could trigger a massive explosion. The more energy it stores up, the faster and more likely to explode it gets!
300: Did you know that Vanillish has existed since the Ice Age? At that time, they moved to southern areas, where they would live in the snowy mountains. They can conceal themselves from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them!
